messages.subject: RE: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Advice please/update
messages.msgSnippet: I saw it and, come to think of it, I did jump a couple of times but that was about it. Good movie though. Aubrey _____ From:
messages.messageBody:
I saw it and, come to think of it, I did jump a couple of times but that was
about it. Good movie though.

Aubrey





_____

From: UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com
[mailto:UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Ren Allen
Sent: Friday, November 11, 2005 8:38 AM
To: UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Advice please/update



"I personally LOVE horror movies. I saw Amityville Horror when I was 6 and
slept on my mom's floor for about 2 months. Now I can't seem to find one
that scares me at all and believe me I've tried. I guess I never will
since
I think like my daughter."

Try "The Grudge". My horror-loving boys said it was pretty damn
scary...and they don't scare easily at all. I wouldn't watch it with
the kids though.
There is a Japanese version that is supposedly a little bit better
than the American one...you could watch them both.
I'll never know, can't handle horror anymore.

Ren

messages.messageBody:
"I personally LOVE horror movies. I saw Amityville Horror when I was 6 and
slept on my mom's floor for about 2 months. Now I can't seem to find one
that scares me at all and believe me I've tried. I guess I never will
since
I think like my daughter."

Try "The Grudge". My horror-loving boys said it was pretty damn
scary...and they don't scare easily at all. I wouldn't watch it with
the kids though.
There is a Japanese version that is supposedly a little bit better
than the American one...you could watch them both.
I'll never know, can't handle horror anymore.

Ren
